text: Alejandra Soler Gilabert (July 8, 1913 - March 1, 2017) was a Spanish politician and teacher. She also worked for the Diplomatic Academy of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation. She was born in Valencia, Spain. She took part in the revolts against Miguel Primo de Rivera's dictature and in 1934, she became a member of the communist party. Soler died on March 1, 2017 in Valencia, Spain from suspected heart failure, aged 103. == Works == * 2009, La vida es un río caudaloso con peligrosos rápidos ==References== Category:1913 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Spanish communists Category:Spanish politicians Category:Spanish centenarians
title: Alejandra Soler
